descript.abstract: 2012 305(b) assessed and 303(d) impaired estuarine hydrology features
descript.purpose: Show all estuarine waters identified in the 2012 Virginia 305(b)/303(d) Water Quality Assessment Integrated Report.
descript.supplinf: Assessment determinations noted in this dataset are based on guidance from Virginia's 2012 Assessment Guidance Memo 11-2007 available at http://www.deq.virginia.gov/Portals/0/DEQ/Water/Guidance/112007.pdf. This dataset has two supplemental GIS data files: the regionally significant VPDES facilities shapefile (va_12ir_vpdes_facilities.shp) and the monitoring stations shapefile (va_12ir_wqm_stations.shp).

idinfo.useconst: Line work and attributes should not be altered except by the developer (VA DEQ). This dataset constitutes the EPA approved digital version of the assessment hydrology for Virginia. Crediting the Virginia Department of Environmental Quality as data source is requested.
idinfo.datacred: This dataset was developed and updated by the Virginia Department of Environmental Quality (VA DEQ) from the United States Geological Survey (USGS) National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) circa 2000. The dataset is maintained and updated by VA DEQ each assessment cycle (biennially) from the current NHD product, aerial photography and by freehand digitizing where necessary.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcGIS 9.2.6.1500; ESRI ArcGIS 9.3.1.3000

dataqual.logic: All arcs and polygons are used to define surface hydrologic features in the state or that VA DEQ is responsible for monitoring and assessment.
dataqual.complete: At the close of each assessment cycle the dataset is submitted to US EPA for approval whereby it is considered Virginia's completed geospatial data product.

procstep.procdesc: Dataset combined from regional assessment unit geodatabases into one statewide layer using Load Objects Command tool in ArcMap.
Single-part features dissolved to create multi-part features using ID305B attribute via the Dissolve Utility in ArcToolbox.
Topology created and rules set to remove common geometry errors.

Calculate Geometry function used to calculate length in miles of riverine features, and area in acres for lakes/reservoirs and square miles for estuarine features in Lambert Conformal Conic NAD 1983 projected coordinate system.

Assessment attributes (i.e. Water Name, Location, Comments, Cause and Source where applicable, Assessment Category, and Designated Use status) for all assessment units joined to each feature based on data queried from the Final 2012 Assessment Database.
Metadata .txt file revised and imported using Metadata Import utility in ArcCatalog.

enttyp.enttypd: estuarine feature data layer which includes tidal/saline waters, the Chesapeake Bay and Virginia's portion of the Atlantic Ocean

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

edom.edomvd: a closed shape of connected coordinate pairs; some features may be multipart polygons

attrdomv.udom: Alpha-numeric assessment unit designation for each hydrologic feature.

attr.attrdef: Area of the feature calculated in square miles

edom.edomvd: Assessment reporting cycle within the time period of 1/1/2005 through 12/31/2010

attr.attrdef: Two-character postal abbreviation of the state where the water features are located

edom.edomvd: Virginia

attrdomv.udom: Location description of the assessment unit.
All causes of impairment that exceeded their Water Quality Standard criteria; otherwise NA to denote assessment units not impaired (i.e. Category 1* or 2*) or not assessed (i.e. Category 3*).
All sources either confirmed or suspected of the given cause(s); otherwise NA to denote assessment units not impaired (i.e. Category 1* or 2*) or not assessed (i.e. Category 3*).

attr.attrdef: Virginia assessment unit Category ID representing the overall assessment characterization of the water body per Assessment Guidance criteria stated in Guidance Memo 11-2007.

edom.edomvd: The water is supporting all designated uses for which it is monitored.
The water is of concern to the state but no Water Quality Standard exists for a specific pollutant, or the water exceeds a state screening value or toxicity test.
The water is now attaining the use(s) for which it was originally 303(d) listed and the TMDL is EPA approved but other applicable use(s) were not monitored and assessed.
There is no data available within the data window of the current assessment to determine if any designated use is attained and the water was not previously listed as impaired.
Some data exists but are insufficient to determine support of any designated use. Such waters will be prioritized for follow up monitoring as needed.
The water is impaired or threatened for one or more designated uses but does not require a TMDL because the TMDL for specific pollutant(s) is complete and US EPA approved.
The Water Quality Standard is not attained. The water is impaired or threatened for one or more designated uses by a pollutant(s) and requires a TMDL (303(d) list).
The Water Quality Standard for the shellfishing use (exclusively) is not attained. One or more pollutants causing impairment require TMDL development.

The Water Quality Standard is not attained due to suspected natural conditions and may require a TMDL. Water Quality Standards for these waters may be reevaluated due to the presence of suspected natural conditions.
The Water Quality Standard is not attained where TMDLs for a pollutant(s) have been developed but one or more pollutants are still causing impairment requiring additional TMDL development.
The Water Quality Standard is attained for a pollutant(s) with a TMDL and 303(d) delisting is approved but the water remains impaired for additional pollutant(s) requiring TMDL development.
The water is fully supporting the criteria set for the aquatic life designated use.
There is insufficient information to determine assessment status for the aquatic life designated use.
The water has not been assessed to determine assessment status of the aquatic life designated use.
The water is not supporting the criteria set for the aquatic life designated use.
The water is fully supporting the criteria set for the deep channel seasonal refuge sub-use.
The deep channel seasonal refuge sub-use is not applicable to this assessment unit.
The water is not supporting the criteria set for the deep channel seasonal refuge sub-use.
The water is fully supporting the criteria set for the deep water aquatic life sub-use.
There is insufficient information to determine assessment status for the deep water aquatic life sub-use.
The deep water aquatic life sub-use is not applicable to this assessment unit.
The water is not supporting the criteria set for the deep water aquatic life sub-use.
The water is fully supporting the criteria set for the fish consumption designated use.
The water has not been assessed to determine assessment status of the fish consumption designated use.
The water is not supporting the criteria set for the fish consumption designated use.

attr.attrdef: Migratory Fish Spawning and Nursery (Aquatic Life) Sub-use

edom.edomvd: There is insufficient information to determine assessment status for the migratory fish spawning and nursery sub-use.
The migratory fish spawning and nursery sub-use is not applicable to this assessment unit.
The water has not been assessed to determine assessment status of the migratory fish spawning and nursery sub-use.
The water is fully supporting the criteria set for the open water aquatic life sub-use.
There is insufficient information to determine assessment status for the open water aquatic life sub-use.
The open water aquatic life sub-use is not applicable to this assessment unit.
The water is not supporting the criteria set for the open water aquatic life sub-use.
The water is fully supporting the criteria set for the public water supply designated use.
The public water supply designated use is not applicable to this assessment unit.
The water has not been assessed to determine assessment status of the public water supply designated use.
The water is fully supporting the criteria set for the recreation designated use.
There is insufficient information to determine assessment status for the recreation designated use.
The water has not been assessed to determine assessment status of the recreation designated use.
The water is not supporting the criteria set for the recreation designated use.

attr.attrdef: Shallow-Water Submerged Aquatic Vegetation (Aquatic Life) Sub-use

edom.edomvd: The water is fully supporting the criteria set for the shallow water submerged aquatic vegetation sub-use.
There is insufficient information to determine assessment status for the shallow water submerged aquatic vegetation sub-use.
The shallow water submerged aquatic vegetation sub-use is not applicable to this assessment unit.
The water is not supporting the criteria set for the shallow water submerged aquatic vegetation sub-use.
The water is fully supporting the criteria set for the shellfishing designated use.
There is insufficient information to determine assessment status for the shellfishing designated use.
The shellfishing designated use is not applicable to this assessment unit.
The water has not been assessed to determine assessment status of the shellfishing designated use.
The water is not supporting the criteria set for the shellfishing designated use.
The water is fully supporting the criteria set for the wildlife designated use.
There is insufficient information to determine assessment status for the wildlife designated use.
The water has not been assessed to determine assessment status of the wildlife designated use.
The water is not supporting the criteria set for the wildlife designated use.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: 2012 305(b) assessed and 303(d) impaired estuarine hydrology features
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Show all estuarine waters identified in the 2012 Virginia 305(b)/303(d) Water Quality Assessment Integrated Report.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: This dataset was developed and updated by the Virginia Department of Environmental Quality (VA DEQ) from the United States Geological Survey (USGS) National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) circa 2000. The dataset is maintained and updated by VA DEQ each assessment cycle (biennially) from the current NHD product, aerial photography and by freehand digitizing where necessary.

Consts.useLimit: Line work and attributes should not be altered except by the developer (VA DEQ). This dataset constitutes the EPA approved digital version of the assessment hydrology for Virginia. Crediting the Virginia Department of Environmental Quality as data source is requested.

dataExt.exDesc: Geographic extent of the statewide resource

dataIdInfo.suppInfo: Assessment determinations noted in this dataset are based on guidance from Virginia's 2012 Assessment Guidance Memo 11-2007 available at http://www.deq.virginia.gov/Portals/0/DEQ/Water/Guidance/112007.pdf. This dataset has two supplemental GIS data files: the regionally significant VPDES facilities shapefile (va_12ir_vpdes_facilities.shp) and the monitoring stations shapefile (va_12ir_wqm_stations.shp).

report.measDesc: All arcs and polygons are used to define surface hydrologic features in the state or that VA DEQ is responsible for monitoring and assessment.
At the close of each assessment cycle the dataset is submitted to US EPA for approval whereby it is considered Virginia's completed geospatial data product.

prcStep.stepDesc: Metadata .txt file revised and imported using Metadata Import utility in ArcCatalog.
Topology created and rules set to remove common geometry errors.

Calculate Geometry function used to calculate length in miles of riverine features, and area in acres for lakes/reservoirs and square miles for estuarine features in Lambert Conformal Conic NAD 1983 projected coordinate system.
Dataset combined from regional assessment unit geodatabases into one statewide layer using Load Objects Command tool in ArcMap.
Single-part features dissolved to create multi-part features using ID305B attribute via the Dissolve Utility in ArcToolbox.

Assessment attributes (i.e. Water Name, Location, Comments, Cause and Source where applicable, Assessment Category, and Designated Use status) for all assessment units joined to each feature based on data queried from the Final 2012 Assessment Database.
